result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 3:26pm
Defendant Ryan J Kraut in court.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

The Court notes that Mr. Kraut remains eligible for public defender representation. 

Mr. Kraut has no objection to adjourning to allow counsel to be appointed. 

recess: 3:30pm

Defendant Ryan J Kraut appears in court. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Kraut that he understands that the Public Defender is continuing efforts to appoint counsel for him; Mr. Kraut agrees to set this over to allow further time for PD to appoint an attorney to represent him.
Mr. Kraut verifies that the 310 Beacon, Palmyra WI address is current.

Status conference on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 9:23AM
Defendant Ryan J Kraut does not appear. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Status Conference, however the Defendant does not appear, either in person or by telephone.
On Motion of the State, the Court sets this matter over for another appearance date. The Court imposes, but stays a warrant until the next scheduled hearing.

The Court notes that that the Defendant may appear by telephone at the next scheduled hearing if he is still in treatment.

recess 9:26AM

NEXT: Status Conference on 06/21 at 10:00AM with in person appearances
You may appear by phone on 6/3.

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 3/23/22

[ae] case called 08:42 AM Defendant Ryan J Kraut appeared by telephone in custody from the Jefferson County Jail. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 except as permitted by the terms of the injunction issued in Walworth County Case 21CV560
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 8:51 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/4/22 at 9:00 am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 6/3/22 at 9:00 am [Defendant informed the Court that he will be transferred to an inpatient treatment facility this week. Clerk is to notify SPD that defendant is requesting representation]
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
